job_title: Visitor Services Assistant in Whipsnade, England
pros: - Pay at £11 an hour - The perks, complimentary tickets and sign ins everyday for 2 people - Flexible
cons: - Long and exhausting hours in the summer - Shifts can’t be guaranteed - Can be boring in the off season

review_title: Nice environment but poor personal development & salary
pros: Nice People Environment Varied Projects
cons: Low Salary No training & development

pros: Friendly colleagues, good location to work. I appreciated the hybrid working model.
cons: Sadly, the salary was only £32,000 per year. They also use inefficient HR system, which in my opinion over complicates the process of keeping all employees personal information. the system is iTrent.

pros: Having the opportunity to work around the animals.
cons: When I worked there I experienced bullying and harassment which has had a permanent impact on my health.

pros: Good staff discount and overtime
cons: negative atmosphere at times making workers do overtime as lack of staff

pros: - Flexible - Free access to the zoo if you wanted it - Staff discount pretty good
cons: - Very little shifts in winter - Management had their favourites - No progression

pros: Conservation mission, well known, rewarding
cons: Too zoo focused, power struggles between directorates

pros:
The different training sessions received since i have started working at ZSL in 2019 have greatly helped my learning 
Friendly, welcoming workplace
Getting to explore both zoos whilst working
Lots of extra perks - discounts for staff, flexible working, interest in your wellbeing
cons: Dress warmly whatever job you are in!

pros:
great company 
friendly managers 
look after their staff
cons: nothing cant fault the company

pros: The environment is great at ZSL. Opportunity to make suggestions and change within the organisation.
cons: Internal communication and working with some departments of the organisation- which is more than likely familiar regardless of industry.

pros: Motivated people, lots of diversity in the types of work being done. Offices in a zoo.
cons: 200 years of history and some internal structures that don't work as well as they could.

pros: A Lovely Environment with a good cause. Full of some good, committed, people and a decent Salary
cons: Lack of Direction from the top and some questionable decision making. It can be a very unstable employment environment with lots of closed doors!

pros: Overall it was a great job. Good pay and all the employees were friendly. Some customers too. You can also choose your shifts which was amazing.
cons: Very busy. Only 30 minute break during a 8-9 hour shift

pros: Contributing to the world in a positive way
cons: Low pay compared to equivalent jobs in non-academic roles

pros:
Great team
Great work life balance
cons:
Slow to promote
Low pay scale

pros: working at the zoo is greeeeeeaat!
cons: Fierce animals try to eat you.

job_title: Research Internship in Royal Tunbridge Wells, England
pros: Fair pay, good working environment (able to walk around the zoo at lunch), good training and support, good perks (e.g. free tickets to the zoo, staff discount in the shop, staff canteen).
cons: Sometimes HR took a long time to respond to queries. Also didn't often interact with other teams. There were some people in the office that I never talked to, because I didn't collaborate with other teams within my job and that meant I often worked alone and didn't get to know other people very well.

pros: great people to work with, passionate teams and wonderful environment
cons: very expensive place to live near, old institution so take a lot of time to do anything, heavily weighted to operations presenting barriers to getting things done.

job_title: Visitor Activity Host in London, England
pros: Excellent company, good core values
cons: The zoo needs more funding , to continue employments.

pros: Easy work, some fun people to work with
cons: Awful management and the tickets are overpriced so you get a lot of complaints

review_title: Do not work there. Even if you love the zoo!
pros: The only good part is that you get to see the zoo everyday. I love looking around the zoo.
cons: I cant speak for the retail side but in admissions it was awful. Worst job ive had. They get away with giving you NO break in a 6 hour day. You get 5 minutes to run toilet thats it. And the management... one women inparticular was truly awful to work for. They were never happy with anything you did, made it clear they pay you (only london living wages) so you should be doing amazing work every minute of the day and made it clear they were above you so were good at making you feel low and like nothing... Hassled into selling and upselling. And if you dont sell enough you dont get asked to come back.. youre told when youre wrong and right, even when you tell them you couldnt giftaid as most guests coming to the booths are from another country, told otherwise because well obviously they know best... rude managers, i dreaded going to work everyday it was the worst feeling ever, and ive worked at alot of places! Its such a shame as i love the zoo and couldnt wait to start working there...

review_title: Good place and people, terrible management
pros: Interesting people, intelligent and passionate. Good work environment and staff canteen. Great to spend time with the animals. Doing good for the world. Staff parties quite good.
cons: Management is terrible. Don't listen to staff and don't manage - too busy with in fighting and trying to gain control of various bits of the zoo. Some staff are difficult and uncooperative. Location is quite far from shops/amenities.

review_title: Be careful what you wish for
pros: The obvious attraction to anyone wanting to work in a zoo is the animals. The view of regents park from some sections is quite nice.
cons: Bullying, harassment, favouritism lack of support, gossip, if you dare to speak out about a bullying problem you are told you should be grateful because you are working at London zoo. ALL staff (not just some) start their careers full of hope and excitement and then end up feeling g trapped. The organisation will NOT change or modernise. I would strongly suggest applying for work at another zoo.

job_title: Seasonal Sales Assistant in London, England
pros: Lovely place to work, nice to work for a charity with a strong ethos and nice overall aim, to conserve and protect animals. Never a boring day, lots of new customers and lots of happy friendly children.
cons: Quite target oriented, which is understandable as targets must be met to fund the work the ZSL does. Not much chance of a permanent position/promotion.

pros: we learn a lot of different things, we work with different people and differences places everyday...Event, restaurent, barista, breakfast, afternoom tea, party...
cons:
when the staff call sick and we are understaff,
so many staff and chefs "steal" drinks and food in the restaurent and the store

review_title: Was a pretty nice place to work.
pros: Nice people to work with, close to the nature and animals.
cons: During busy times this job could be pretty stressful.

job_title: Seasonal Sales Associate in London, England
pros:
Staff discount 
Get to visit the animals /invite up to 3 family and friends to visit the zoo
cons: I don’t have any cons

job_title: Seasonal Sales Assistant in London, England
pros: Fun environment and great team.
cons: Terrible, power hungry management. Not understanding of the fact that the zoo is a charity and not a high-street retail shop.

pros: Access to the zoo. Contributing to conservation.
cons: No leadership. No resources to do job or achieve goals. Workload excessive.

review_title: Great location, colleagues but unfortunately little to no opportunity for career development and progression.
pros: Passionate colleagues, good mission and great location.
cons: Poor compensation and limited opportunities for development and advancement.

pros: The people are lovely, really nice environment to work in and organisation has good values.
cons: Leadership team could be more visible

pros: Nothing it’s a horrible place to work
cons: Everything. Food sucks it’s overpriced

pros: Fantastic learning experience, lots of opportunities, supportive management
cons: Unpaid internship, so difficult to manage alongside other employment

review_title: Good, but not many progression opportunities

pros: Great people, animals and srchitecture
